{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient's symptoms of urinary leakage during physical activity and when laughing or coughing are indicative of stress incontinence. This is often due to urethral hypermobility, which can occur after vaginal childbirth. The patient's history of an uncomplicated vaginal delivery 10 years ago supports this diagnosis. Diabetic polyuria and primary polydipsia typically present with excessive thirst and urination, which the patient does not report. A vesicovaginal fistula would likely present with continuous leakage of urine, not just during physical activity or coughing/laughing.", "answer_choice": "C. Urethral hypermobility"}
